A4.text: She wrote 66 detective novels and 14 short story collections, particularly those revolving around fictional detectives Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple.

A5.text: She was called the 'Queen of Crime'â€”a nickname now trademarked by her estate.

A6.text: She also wrote six romantic novels under the pseudonym Mary Westmacott.

A7.text: She wrote more Poirot stories than any of the others, even though she thought the character to be 'rather insufferable'.
